title: Bill Maher predicts Republicans will get 'dogs--t kicked out' of them in midterms over immigration

description: The Navy announced an apology and a path to reinstatement for service members discharged over the COVID-19 vaccine mandate as the Pentagon moves to review and correct past separations.
title: Navy Under Secretary Hung Cao says personnel discharged over vaccine mandate were 'failed'

description: A new Pentagon document says its defense strategy is pivoting toward burden-sharing as the U.S. plans a "more limited" role in deterring North Korea and other parts of the world.
title: Pentagon plans to give South Korea primary role in deterring North Korea threats under new strategy

description: Federal officials give Minnesota 60-day ultimatum amid alleged childcare fraud scandal involving millions in taxpayer dollars and compliance issues.
title: Minnesota 'on the clock' as HHS threatens penalties over childcare fraud scandal

description: Cissie Graham Lynch shares how March for Life transformed her views as young families and students lead the charge defending unborn children nationwide.
title: Cissie Graham Lynch warns abortion fight ‘far from over’ at annual March for Life in DC

description: An Ohio man who allegedly threatened ICE agents on social media is facing federal charges after authorities found guns and tactical gear at his home.
title: Man who allegedly threatened to shoot ICE agents had rifles, body armor and ammo cache, feds say

description: As the Lakers struggle on the court, LeBron James downplayed reports of friction with team governor Jeanie Buss. James asserted he’s not bothered by how others feel about him.
title: Lakers' LeBron James shrugs off reported tension with Jeanie Buss: 'It don't bother me'

description: A threatening letter allegedly sent to the California GOP reportedly calls for violence against ICE agents, including detailed bomb-making instructions.
title: Anonymous letter to California GOP chapter calls for war on ICE, urges agents be sent 'home in a body bag'

description: Anti-ICE agitators swarmed the Target Center in Minneapolis Friday, and thousands marched downtown demanding a stop to federal immigration enforcement operations in the city.
title: Thousands march through Minneapolis, swarm Target Center demanding ICE removal from Minnesota

description: Alejandro Castillo, accused of murdering coworker "Sandy" Ly Le in 2016, was transferred to Charlotte after his arrest in Mexico after a yearslong manhunt.
title: FBI Director Kash Patel hails transfer of Most Wanted fugitive Alejandro Rosales Castillo after Mexico arrest

description: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani defends anti-Israel activist Mahmoud Khalil against Trump deportation efforts, calling him "a New Yorker" who deserves to stay.
title: Mamdani tells Trump administration anti-Israel activist should 'remain in New York City' amid deportation case

description: German soccer federation Vice President Oke Göttlich called for boycotting the 2026 FIFA World Cup in response to President Donald Trump's recent actions.
title: German soccer executive calls for World Cup boycott to protest Trump

description: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani announced New York's pre-K and 3-K enrollment is open to all children regardless of immigration status, with ICE agents denied school access without warrants.
title: Mamdani clarifies NYC won't check immigration status for universal childcare enrollees

description: The Trump administration demanded a Long Island school district restore its Thunderbirds mascot after a federal investigation found a civil rights violation.
title: Federal officials demand New York school district bring back Thunderbirds mascot after civil rights probe

description: Democratic strategist James Carville endorses James Talarico over Rep. Jasmine Crockett in a Texas Senate race, citing better electoral viability.
title: Carville says Crockett's rhetoric offends people with 'any sense of humanity,' will not be viable candidate

description: Golfer Justin Thomas blasted the NCAA for ruining college sports, saying that at some point schools and coaches have to say enough is enough.
title: PGA Tour star Justin Thomas rips NCAA for current state of college sports

description: Faith leaders and clergy arrested at Minneapolis airport during anti-ICE protest demanding airlines refuse federal immigration enforcement cooperation.
title: Anti-ICE agitators, including clergy, arrested at Minneapolis airport during protest in frigid weather

description: Stay up to date with the Fox News Campus Radicals newsletter, which brings you the in-depth investigative stories from college campuses nationwide.

description: California is suing the Trump administration over a pipeline restart tied to the 2015 Refugio oil spill that dumped 100,000-plus gallons into state waters.
title: California sues Trump administration over alleged 'unlawful' pipeline restart approval years after oil spill

description: Webb County Sheriff Martin Cuellar Jr., brother of Trump-pardoned Rep. Henry Cuellar, was indicted. The DOJ alleges he used staff, resources and funds for a COVID cleaning business.
title: Trump's pardon of House Dem Cuellar back in the spotlight as Cuellar's brother faces indictment

description: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding was escorted by the FBI at an Ontario airport after surrendering to face federal charges for allegedly running a drug trafficking network.
title: Ex-Olympian Ryan Wedding arrives in US, escorted off plane in cuffs by FBI after Mexico capture

description: Former CNN editor-at-large Chris Cillizza questioned whether his ex-colleague Don Lemon should be considered a journalist following the liberal host's actions at the Minnesota church.
title: Ex-CNN colleague of Don Lemon questions whether he should be considered a journalist

description: The media was quick to parrot Democrats, including Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., who shared an image of a five-year-old boy and claimed he was detained by ICE.
title: Media runs wild with ‘egregious lie’ ICE targeted 5-year-old in Minnesota, DHS says child was abandoned

description: As part of the America250 celebration, the Department of Transportation is pushing for plans for an IndyCar race on the National Mall, with Aug. 21 eyed as race day.
title: Trump administration pushing for IndyCar race on National Mall for America250

description: Abu Dhabi hosts trilateral meeting with the U.S., Ukraine and Russia in a possible sign that the nearly four-year war could be coming to an end.
title: Russia, Ukraine to discuss territory as Trump says both sides 'want to make a deal'

description: Iran’s top prosecutor Mohammad Movahedi is criticizing an announcement from President Donald Trump that Iran recently canceled more than 800 executions.

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney rejected President Donald Trump's claim that "Canada lives because of the United States," declaring Canada "thrives because we are Canadian."
title: Canadian PM Carney fires back at Trump over claim that 'Canada lives because of the United States'

description: A Russian oil tanker was intercepted between Spain and Morocco as western powers intensify efforts to disrupt Moscow's sanctions-evading shadow fleet operations.
title: Russian oil tanker, the Grinch, intercepted as US, allies escalate sanctions crackdown

description: An Arizona OnlyFans star was allegedly kidnapped at gunpoint in Mexico, according to video. Nicole Pardo Molina's abduction may be linked to a cartel rivalry in Sinaloa.
title: American OnlyFans star with Mexican cartel ties kidnapped at gunpoint outside mall

description: ISIS prisoners escaped from a northeastern Syria prison, and some remain unaccounted for after chaos made tracking impossible, according to Syria analyst Nanar Hawach.
title: ISIS fighters still at large after Syrian prison break, contributing to volatile security situation

description: U.S. Treasury sanctioned Zaher Birawi, 64, alleging the Britain-based activist serves as a Hamas senior official through a Popular Conference for Palestinians Abroad leadership role.
title: Trump pressures UK over Hamas-linked figure as US intel flags potential terror threat

description: Denmark's prime minister said she won't negotiate her nation's sovereignty after President Donald Trump said a "framework" on a Greenland deal was reached.

description: Iran's prosecutor general Mohammad Movahedi claims government crushed nationwide protests as death toll reaches 544 with over 10,681 arrested.

description: President Donald Trump calls the United Kingdom's Chagos Islands transfer plan "an act of great stupidity," warning China could exploit the deal.
title: Trump slams UK island handoff deal that could put key US military base at risk

description: U.S. forces moved 150 ISIS detainees from Syria to Iraq as CENTCOM began a transfer operation involving up to 7,000 radical prisoners.
title: US begins transferring ISIS detainees from Syria to Iraq amid security transition

description: Nigeria's military rescued 62 hostages and killed two militants in operations across Zamfara, Kebbi and Sokoto states after weekend church kidnappings.
title: 62 Nigerian hostages rescued, 2 militants killed, army says

description: More than 4,500 protesters killed in Iran as foreign minister threatens forceful response to potential U.S. military strikes in escalating regional crisis.
title: Iran will retaliate 'with everything we have' if US attacks, senior diplomat warns

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he will join President Donald Trump’s newly formed Gaza Board of Peace after initially criticizing its structure.
title: Netanyahu agrees to join Trump’s Gaza Board of Peace after initial pushback

description: Iranian soldier Javid Khales was reportedly sentenced to death for refusing orders to shoot protesters during nationwide unrest, a human rights group says.
title: Iranian soldier sentenced to death for refusing to fire on protesters during nationwide unrest

description: Iran protests entered day 24 with 4,519 confirmed deaths. Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei backs security forces amid nationwide demonstrations.
title: Armed militias fire heavy machine guns through Tehran streets in deadly night attacks

description: Swiss riots erupt in multiple cities as anti-Trump protesters march against President Trump's World Economic Forum appearance, with police deploying water cannons.
title: American flags torched, riot police clash with protesters ahead of Trump Davos arrival

description: Israel warns Iran not to test its military readiness amid tensions over ballistic missiles and nuclear capabilities following summer 2025 operations.

description: President Donald Trump invited dozens of countries including Russia, China, and Ukraine to join his Board of Peace initiative, with a signing ceremony planned for Davos, Switzerland.
title: Trump floats ‘Board of Peace’ to replace UN, signals major global power shift

description: U.S. military forces apprehended Motor Vessel Sagitta in the Caribbean as part of Operation Southern Spear targeting sanctioned tanker vessels.
title: US forces apprehend sanctioned vessel in Caribbean maritime operation targeting illicit oil transport

description: European Parliament member Anders Vistisen confronts President Donald Trump's Greenland interest with profanity-laced rebuke, drawing a reprimand from parliament leadership.

description: ISIS-K claims responsibility for deadly suicide blast at Chinese restaurant in Kabul, killing seven people, including one Chinese national.
title: ISIS takes credit for Kabul suicide bombing at Chinese restaurant

description: A string of shark attacks near Sydney prompted beach closures across New South Wales. The latest victim attacked at Point Plomer suffered only minor cuts.
title: Fourth shark attack in three days rocks Australia as authorities close beaches and deploy drumlines

description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday confirmed Russian President Vladimir Putin was invited to the Board of Peace for supervision of the Gaza plan.

description: The US will also offer “more limited” support to US allies, according to a new national defence strategy document.

description: The US president's comments have been condemned by international allies, including UK veterans and politicians.

description: Brits, Canadians and Danes were among those who saw the toughest fighting, writes the BBC's security correspondent.
title: Frank Gardner: Not only Americans risked life and limb to serve in Afghanistan

description: Nico Antic was swimming in Sydney Harbour when he was attacked last Sunday.
